intro: Cryptantha spiculifera, commonly known as the spiky cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, adapted to conserve moisture in arid environments. Cryptantha spiculifera is often found in rocky soils and is a common sight in desert and semi-desert regions.
